intro: Bosqueia manongarivensis, commonly known as the Manongarivensis Bosqueia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in moist forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
